definition: off course/lost (of ship or plane)/having lost one's way

sentences.english: She is not, however, as smart as “Star Trek’s” computers.
sentences.chinese: 當然，它還不能像《星際迷航》裏的計算機那樣聰明。
我們在《星際迷航》中，哇塞。

sentences.english: Another piece of Star Trek technology has become a reality.
sentences.chinese: 另一項《星際迷航》劇集中的科技變成了現實。

sentences.english: The ship got lost and sailed too close to the icy Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 這條船迷航了，結果開得離冰天雪地的南極洲太近了。

sentences.english: Prajna Paramita is a sword that can cut out unnecessary tangling and involving!
sentences.chinese: 般若波羅蜜多，是明燈，能指引迷航的水手。

sentences.english: Rudderless, we drift athwart a tempest, and when once the storm of youth is past.
sentences.chinese: 我們迷航飄蕩於風暴中，青春的雷雨一旦過去。

sentences.english: We already planned a Star Trek night Sarah : Star Trek is for dorks.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經計劃好《星艦迷航記》之夜了。

sentences.english: A student became lost during a solo cross-country flight.
sentences.chinese: 一個飛行學員放單飛的時候迷航了。

sentences.english: Go for the Star Trek wine glasses.
sentences.chinese: 想要找星際迷航的酒瓶眼鏡嗎？

definition: (of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
to return to the point of departure
(of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
course/direction (a ship or plane is heading in)
to force a plane to land
